name: Residence Inn By Marriott Gravenhurst Muskoka Wharf

reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay
reviews.text: Me and my gf stayed here for one night during thanksgiving weekend. The hotel is excellent. It's pretty new and the staff treated us very nice as well. There's a swimming pool and a hot tub area indoor. The breakfast included was amazing you wouldn't want to miss. Overall I would recommend to everyone.

Like all the other reviews, this place is really good. Amazing location, right at the lake, very beautiful too look at when you park your car (we didn't get the lakeview room). The rooms are spectacularly well designed. I loved it! I loved the kitchen and how many thoughtful items it comes with (all the sets of utensils you will need, two nice useful pots, plates and even a measuring cup!) We made our own dinner so all of these were useful, we didn't need to use our paper plates we brought!
reviews.title: Good interior, amazing location, with one big BUT.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the king studio with 4 people, 2 of us slept on the sofa bed. The mattress of the king bed was average not too bad but nothing super. The sofa bed mattress was very flimsy however you cannot expect too much, we were able to fall asleep but not too comfortable. The breakfast wasn't too bad either. Had everything you expect from free continental buffet. However everything that was cooked does not taste good two out of the four had stomach aches after.
reviews.title: Right on the Boardwalk

reviews.text: Now I must write the biggest problem, the one big BUT. Which is the walls. One other review here says the walls are very good, which could be true as I cannot hear anything in the hall way. However, when we were sleeping all we could here is the the water usage from upstairs (we were first floor). This annoyed me to no end. I do not want to hear everytime someone upstairs uses a bathroom. Expect this from a motel not a 230 bucks per night studio room which the developers hope that you will one day purchase as a cottage!
reviews.title: HOME AWAY FROM HOME

reviews.text: Overall everything was great would be 5/5 but the thin walls just killed it for me.
reviews.title: All hotels should be like this!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the King room Lake view. As we where looking for a place with a full kitchen, the Marriott had the best price compared to some of the other resorts in the Muskoka's. The hotel is very clean and modern, breakfast was awesome with make your own waffles , eggs, sausage. hash browns and lots of fruit, cereal and yes included with the price. The room was also spotless and modern , stainless steel appliances. gas fireplace and balcony overlooking the bay. The kitchen comes in handy, if you're like us and like to save money by cooking your own meals sometimes. The only draw back was there was no oven and I would think a full kitchen means an oven as well. So instead of Pizza in the oven, we had pork loin on the BBQ downstairs and it came out great. I would say we had 1 of the 2 best views in the hotel, room 512(ours) and 514 have the best views, remember the higher up on the floors, the better the view. The staff where Great :)
reviews.title: Great price - Great view
One night stay in October
reviews.text: We were touring late October and after passing a couple of run down looking motels came across this hotel. Check in very friendly and helpful, ( liked the senior rate offered) .
Room large and comfortable and fully equipped. Much more than B and B needed.
reviews.title: Why bother going to Cuba, Dominica or Jamaica...

reviews.text: Great find, breakfast very adequate and set us up to continue touring
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love this place. Stayed there several times for our summer vacation.
reviews.title: Breathtaking Getaway

reviews.text: I have stayed at this property on more than one occasion, and shame on me for taking so long to write a review. Each time I have visited this property, the room has been beatiful, clean, and the staff are great! Be sure to take a walk while you are here, the view is stunning!
reviews.title: Stunning!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a lake-view studio and the view was amazing. The goods: clean, friendly staff, nice breakfast with a variety of hot and cold servings, walking distance to everything in Muskoka Wharf, the views (for lake-view suites). The bads: no security safe in the room, pricey.
reviews.title: Excellent view n location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay and luckily the weather was co-operating during our time in Muskoka.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: Everyone at the front desk is friendly and helpful. Breakfast is vast and delicious.The views are great. And most importantly very very clean!
reviews.title: Stunning autumn in Muskoka

reviews.text: A great experience all around :)
reviews.title: We loved everything about it!
Don't know basic bookepping
reviews.text: Stayed there as part of a wedding party on Canadian Thanksgiving weekend, 2013. To pay over $200 as a special rate for the offseason is somewhat overpriced, hotel is nothing special. Had a ground floor room, no screen on window, anyone could have crawled in. The realy kicker is that I paid a room charge in cash upon leaving, but my credit card was charged. Upon phoning the hotel, the manager was insistent that no payment had been made, when the error was discovered the only explanation given, and I quote:"After reviewing the invoice its looks like the front desk agent charged your credit card instead of posting cash." Caveat emptor!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel merits a big BRAVO. The location is outstanding, right on the Muskoka Warf next to the marine museum, across from the tour boat dock and within a short (15 min.) walk to several eateries, the tour boats and walking trails. Just a couple minutes by car to downtown and about 10 minutes off of Hwy. 11.
reviews.title: Terrific value in great location

reviews.text: Room (studio suite) was great with full-size frig, two-burner stove, microwave, coffee, a full balcony and a big flat-screen TV with many cable channels. Hot buffet breakfast included. WOW. Staff was really helpful. Superb value. Would return in a second.
reviews.title: Your getaway cove

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Been here once and back again with the nice view overlooking the lake. This indeed is a nice treat, specially with a very affordable price during this season. And what a season to be at, fall leaves with nice crisp air surrounds you. The Marriott way welcomes you with a nice hot breakfast buffet. The room has a balcony with muskoka chairs -yes, muskoka and NOT Adirondack!!
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gravenhurst may be limited to shops and other sights but I suggest to visit the 3 surrounding towns to feel the Muskoka experience, towns namely: Bracebridge, Huntsville and most specially Port Carling where the other resort is located - J.W. Marriott Hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent views and convenience

aka: Residence Inn Gravenhurst Muskoka Wharf Hotel Gravenhurst
description: The Residence Inn by Marriott Gravenhurst Muskoka Wharf is the newest Muskoka Hotel and situated on the shores of beautiful Lake Muskoka offering guest complimentary breakfast, high speed internet access and is pet friendly.
